content.title: Subclavian Vascular Injury
content.description: Management of subclavian artery and vein injuries

key_concepts.details: Deep location behind clavicle; may require median sternotomy, clavicle resection, or trap door
Brachial plexus injury, pneumothorax, hemothorax, esophageal injury common
Covered stents increasingly used for select stable patients; reduces surgical morbidity
High mortality (20-30%) due to associated injuries and hemorrhage

content.clinical_significance: Complex anatomic exposure requires experienced surgical team
content.statement: Subclavian Vascular Injury is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Trauma that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Subclavian Vascular Injury helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Subclavian Vascular Injury include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Subclavian Vascular Injury.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Subclavian Vascular Injury. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
